column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The beautiful thing about this little secret garden is that it's not secret at all. It's right on Michigan Avenue. The key is that you step down into it
column2: which removes you from the plane of the sidewalk. Honey locusts (a favorite of Chicago local hero Alfred Caldwell of the Lincoln Park Lilly Pool fame) form a canopy above you- their tiny leaves allowing for sunlight to dapple down onto the crunchy paths. The huge planters that the honey locusts are planted in make for little seating areas
column3: eliminating the need for unnecessary benches. The crowning glory of this little garden is the water feature towards the back of the garden. The splashing of the water
column5: and the soft canopy overhead almost completely eliminate any sounds from Michigan Avenue - save for the occassional ambulance.
